title: UX Designer
description:
UX Designer - 85001

Technology and Engineering - USA New York, New York

UX Designer

We're looking for a UX Designer to be part of our growing UX team in New York City, supporting web applications that empower advertisers, publishers and agencies with the intelligence they need to drive revenue, increase market share, and optimize their audiences and investments around the globe. Working hand-in-hand with our highly-engaged product managers, engineers and an international UX consortium supporting shared UX tools, processes and resources, you will be part of a foundational team that shapes the future of Nielsen software solutions.

As a UX Designer you will:
• Research and align users’ and business needs for desirable outcomes.
• Analyze and understand complex systems and the product life-cycle.
• Craft intuitive solutions for complex process and business problems, through personas, journey maps, sketches, flow diagrams, wireframes, prototypes and final assets for development.
•... Design scalable concepts for multiple applications.
• Contribute to our design system repository.
• Use qualitative and quantitative methods to validate and improve your design.
• Work alongside teams of stakeholders, product managers, engineers, program managers, commercial leaders and UX across the globe.

Experience:
• At least 3 years of experience as a UX Designer or Information Architect for B2B web applications (much more experience is fine).
• Proficiency with executing the full UX design life cycle - from preliminary research through journey-mapping, persona development, prototyping, usability testing, and interaction design with all relevant planning and deliverables.
• Contributing to a design system in an enterprise organization.
• Leading and working independently
• Balancing work on multiple initiatives from estimating to planning and delivery.
• Skills and mindset:
• You’re a master of empathy both for the user and co-workers to enable you to communicate and design effectively.
• Ability to define the information architecture behind data-driven web applications that results in intuitive and user-friendly categorization, schema, mapping, and navigation.
• Attention for details, strong organizational and analytical skills and business acumen.
• A collaborative design mentality with a need for continuous learning.
• Excellent communication skills - You can effectively establish understanding and rationale of your designs and information architecture verbally (in English) and visually.
• Keen sense of aesthetics for both design and communication.
• Proficiency with design tools, such as Axure, Sketch or Figma.
• Ability to provide user data, heuristics and design systems components and guidelines to inform product management and engineering decisions.
• Comfortable working in a large, international, corporate and cross time-zone environment with remote teams.
• Extra points for:
• Experience or keen interest in storytelling through data visualization.
• Knowledge and background working in the marketing industry.
• A portfolio demonstrating proficiency and success in user-centered design.
• An academic degree in a relevant field.

LI-RC1

ABOUT NIELSEN

As the arbiter of truth, Nielsen Global Media fuels the media industry with unbiased, reliable data about what people watch and listen to. To discover what’s true, we measure across all channels and platforms⁠—from podcasts to streaming TV to social media. And when companies and advertisers are armed with the truth, they have a deeper understanding of their audiences and can accelerate growth.

Do you want to move the industry forward with Nielsen? Our people are the driving force. Your thoughts, ideas and expertise can propel us forward. Whether you have fresh thinking around maximizing a new technology or you see a gap in the market, we are here to listen and take action. Our team is made strong by a diversity of thoughts, experiences, skills, and backgrounds. You’ll enjoy working with smart, fun, curious colleagues, who are passionate about their work. Come be part of a team that motivates you to do your best work!

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class.

title: UX Designer
description:
Description

We are looking for a UX Designer to join us as we innovate and streamline campaign planning, management, and reporting experiences, making the complex seem simple. You’ll be involved in all aspects of product development from brainstorming the next innovation to working collaboratively with user research, engineering, product management to bring it to life.

We are looking for a user experience designer that loves learning, and is passionate about conceiving experiences in the abstract and then driving that vision into solid design deliverables such as complex workflows, wireframes, user interface designs, interaction models, and prototypes. You have comprehensive understanding of the current state of web technology and best practices, with a critical awareness of implications on user-centered design and functionality. You are detail-oriented, comfortable working on technical teams, skilled in using data to make decisions and able to thrive in a fast-paced... environment.

At Amazon we put our customer’s first in everything we do – including our advertising programs. We are investing heavily in building solutions that enable brands to connect with their customers—globally and at scale—where they shop, read, watch videos, and share online. The AUX team excels at distilling the needs of a diverse user base into experiences that balance efficiency with robust utility.

Key Responsibilities
• Create user-centered designs by considering market analysis, data, customer feedback, user research and technical constraints/opportunities.
• Quickly and thoroughly create user flows, wireframes, design mockups, and prototypes to effectively conceptualize new product initiatives.
• Relentlessly simplify and distill complex processes into intuitive and elegant UI.
• Establish and maintain detailed user-interface patterns and specifications—working closely with developers to see your design through to deployment.
• Communicate complex, interactive design concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization.

Basic Qualifications
• 3+ years of design experience
• An available online portfolio

Preferred Qualifications
• Ability to create interactive experiences with prototyping software or by hand
• Understanding of HTML, Javascript and CSS that informs design and interaction decisions
• Desire to work in a start-up style environment, where iteration is encouraged
• Visual design acumen demonstrated through owning product design end-to-end
• Proven ability to work cross-team and synthesize feedback and input from business leaders, product management, and engineering
• Experience designing digital advertising solutions or enterprise products
• Experience with designing products for global markets.
• Excellent communication, presentation, interpersonal and analytical skills including the ability to communicate complex, interactive design concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization

title: Junior UX Designer
description:
Brilliant Experience’s team works directly with clients to make research-driven and human-centered product and service design recommendations.

The Jr. UX Designer is inquisitive, open to learning, and wants a strong foundation in a range of user research methods.

They do this by:
• Articulating the best UX approach for a problem through wireframes and prototypes
• Helping to shape and support how we tell customer stories, whether that’s through video, infographics, personas, journey maps and more
• Having an understanding of the advantages (and limitations) of user experience and/or consumer research methodologies
• Having the instincts for (and some experience in) recommending the right approach for a given project

RESPONSIBILITIES

The Jr. UX Designer at Brilliant Experience will:
• Work with the Brilliant Experience team, and with clients, to create user-centric recommendations
• Create wireframes and prototypes to help illustrate solutions
• Help execute research (setup... moderation, data analysis) that solves a range of problems
• Support result summaries, personas, journey and opportunity maps, and (when appropriate) suggest updated information architectures, wireframes, etc.
• Be a key contributor to a team (of 1 to many)
• Help support responses to new business opportunities (note: this is not sales, but we’re a small company)

REQUIREMENTS
• 1-3 years of hands-on client experience outside of an academic program
• High proficiency in at least two prototyping tools (Axure, Sketch, Figma)
• A portfolio of work samples (see “How to Apply” below for more information). One of these samples should include a prototype
• A working knowledge of different research methods, such as ethnography, contextual inquiry, participatory design, surveys, online remote testing, lab observation, etc.
• A related, secondary skill to show cross-discipline thinking. For instance: interface design, information architecture, graphic design, data science, content strategy, etc.
• Comfortable participating in client workshops
• Good at reading people and building professional relationships
• A strong verbal and written communicator
• A degree in HCI (or a related discipline), or equivalent professional experience
• Due to client needs, must be a U.S. citizen

LOCATION

For the foreseeable future, this is a work-from-home position.

Eventually, this role requires regular on-site time in the Washington, D.C. or New York city area. There may also be occasional and minimal travel (less than 10% per quarter on average).

Unfortunately, we can’t provide relocation costs.

BENEFITS

As cliché as it might sound, we want you to live your best life. Satisfied people do their best work.

We provide a highly-competitive salary, platinum-level medical and dental insurance, a monthly cell phone stipend, a 401(K) plan, annual paid training opportunities, and unlimited vacation.

HOW TO APPLY
• You must provide a portfolio of work, ideally online. We’re sorry that we can’t accept applicants who do not submit a portfolio.
• Tell us in less than 250 words why you might be a fit for this role; or why you’re interested; or an accomplishment that aligns with the job description.
• Resumes must be submitted on our website, or sent to careers@brilliantexperience.com. Unfortunately, we can’t accept resumes through LinkedIn or social media channels.

Principles only. No staffing agencies, please.

Brilliant Experience is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
DESCRIPTION

Amazon's Custom Advertising organization is looking for a talented and passionate Sr. UX Designer to create first-class customer experiences both on and offline within the team dedicated to creating advertising solutions for Financial Services and Telecommunication brands.

From inception through launch, you will be a design owner, responsible for delivering ambitious concepts, and using data to iterate and improve, translating needs and constraints into simple, intuitive, customer-focused solutions. You will define and be equally strong at concept and execution, articulating end-to-end experiences, and turn that vision into high-quality design deliverables such as user interface designs for voice and screen, interaction models, design specs, prototypes, and interactive advertising campaigns. You balance your passion for inspired, compelling, elegant and intuitive designs with a highly analytical nature, precise execution, and a drive to design, build and deliver.

As... part of this team, you will work under the guidance of a Creative Director and collaborate closely with other creatives (including art directors, copywriters, and fellow designers), design technologists, and program managers. Additionally, you will be responsible for communicating with both internal partners (including Sales, product, and engineering teams) and external advertisers to deliver innovative results through all stages from concept development to final execution.

Responsibilities

Be customer obsessed. Think strategically.
• Dive deep on the target audience (considering a brand's target audience as well as Amazon shopper behavior) to find meaningful insights to inform creative strategy and approach to solutions
• Understand human behavior. Focus the work on solving real customer problems by putting yourself in the customer's shoes; if you wouldn't read/watch/use/share your solution, they won't either

Insist on the highest standards of creative.
• Collaborate across multiple teams to drive executions of all types (video, digital, voice integration, AR, VR, etc.)
• Work with program managers to ensure timelines, resources, and budget allocations meet project scope
• Deliver multi-channel brand solutions of the highest standard that balance advertiser goals (KPIs) with customer goals (frictionless commerce)
• Ensure flawless execution, from exquisite design, to on-time, error-free delivery

Take ownership of the business.
• Maintain a high-level view across the business. Understand the complexities, dependencies and opportunities beyond our immediate team
• Understand the Amazon Advertising platform and how to sell it, work within the existing framework as well as push new functionalities and adapting with the business as it evolves over time
• Create ideas and executions that can become scalable executions (and revenue streams) in the future
• From concept to execution, know the tools, steps, and policies of the solutions you deploy

Take ownership of client and agency relationships.
• Work with client services to build strategic business partnerships with your clients, inspiring and exciting them about our creative work and our delivery on their brand promise
• Ensure your clients and agency partners know you and value your input and tenure on their business
• Use your understanding to create a clear vision for creative solutions and ensure this vision is clearly communicated and understood with both clients, planning, and the account team
• Articulate and defend strategic thinking and creative direction to internal and external stakeholders.
• Deliver high standards of client satisfaction, measuring through feedback, open communication, surveys, response to campaigns and continuously adapting and adjusting approaches to benefit client need

Earn trust. Be a thought leader.
• Be a creative ambassador. Help build a culture of creative thinking and innovation with internal teams, client and agency partners.
• Ensure clear communication upwards and downwards within the team and set expectations you will meet by managing your time and projects, being mindful of those you are collaborating with as much as deadlines
• Educate, inspire and motivate colleagues across the organization to help them understand, protect, and sell the strongest creative ideas to clients

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

• 8+ years of design experience
• An available online portfolio
• Minimum of 6+ years of design experience is acceptable, which can be a combination of product, UX, UI, interactive, and visual design
• In-depth understanding of industry design tools (Ex. Adobe Creative Cloud, Sketch, InVision)

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

• Has a deep understanding of Financial Services and Telecommunication brands
• Experience in advertising or marketing is a plus
• Data-driven and obsessed with measurable impact of a campaign
• Strong portfolio demonstrating UX thinking and process, visual design skills, and crafting interactive/digital experiences that solve for a customer/business problem
• Excellent presentation skills and interactive storytelling ability
• Strong organization and collaboration skills
• A fascination with innovation and technology
• Self-starter. Ability to manage ambiguity, work autonomously, and multi-task

About the Job

As we build the next generation of digital products, success will be defined by the quality of the User Experience. The job of UX Designer is to research, design, and help deliver digital products that delight our users while satisfying the firm’s business goals.

As a member of the UX team, you will be responsible for defining the form and function of web, desktop, & mobile applications. You will work with business and development teams in a variety of businesses at Goldman Sachs to define, design, and validate the user experience for internal and external users. In addition, you will help shape our overall design system and visual language, with a code library that is used in hundreds of projects at the firm.

We enjoy taking deep dives into complex problems, surrounded by a network of passionate people who help each other grow. Our team's range of skills and diversity of approaches allows us to partner with business and technology teams firm-wide to create applications that are easy to use, engaging, powerful, and competitive. title: Product / UX Designer, (London, NYC, SF, Remote)
description:
About Us

Taptap Send is VC-backed (Canaan, Reid Hoffman, and several others), rapidly growing and a great place for those looking for both impact and a fast-paced tech startup environment. Read more about the journey in Reid Hoffman's words.

Our product is an app-based solution that lets immigrants send money back home to emerging markets instantly and at very low prices. Since launching in summer 2018, we've already moved tens of millions of dollars and reached tens of thousands of customers. We're live in seven European countries, and we support payments into Senegal, Mali, Zambia, Guinea, Ghana, Ivory Coast, Cameroon, Kenya, Madagascar, DR Congo, Morocco, Vietnam and Bangladesh; with lots more countries launching soon.

Global remittances account for over $500 billion annually, most of which moves back into developing countries. But the market is dominated by traditional services that are expensive, can take days to arrive, and have limited reach in rural areas. We're helping... people to send that money instantly and securely at a fraction of the cost.

Our team is based across London, New York, Paris and Brussels, and we pride ourselves on hiring exceptional talent -- our team members come from a wide variety of top-tier tech companies, professional services firms, and industry leaders, including Twitter, Yahoo, Amazon, Google, McKinsey, Bain & Co, KPMG, Cravath, and Vodafone.

To continue our rapid growth, we're looking to bring on people who are passionate about our mission and excited to work in a small start-up environment. We have competitive salary and stock options and great benefits, and we were recently rated one of the best companies to escape to by Escape the City's "Escape 100".

Role:

As Taptap Send's first product / UX designer you will own the end-to-end user experience and visual design of our product. This will include everything from conducting user research to defining our design process, creating wireframes and testing prototypes with users. You will work closely with not only our Product and Engineering teams, but also with Customer Support and Growth.

This role is perfect for you if you have deep empathy for our users, and experience designing for consumer mobile products (preferably for the diaspora communities). You are comfortable working cross-functionally in a rapidly changing start-up environment, and assume an extreme ownership mindset.

Responsibilities:
• Design delightful user experience based on user interviews, experimentation, analytics, etc
• Build wireframes and prototypes to tackle difficult UX problems (i.e., ship your designs).
• Collaborate across functions to help define products from the beginning
• Lead and improve upon our product design process, including design reviews and testing
• Own and improve upon our design patterns and systems

Requirements:
• 5+ years experience in UX, UI, HCI for consumer mobile

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
About Narrativ
Narrativ is a subscription technology platform for brands to acquire new customers through trust-based marketing. We built an ad-free alternative to the e-commerce growth marketing playbook by building the commerce and payments infrastructure for the creator economy.
Brands know consumers are tired of being inundated with ads that only tell one side of the story - yet the marketing playbook hasn’t evolved. Unlike search engine marketing or social marketing, trust-based marketing is honest and unbiased, balanced with both pros and cons, and comes from diverse voices that speak with integrity and specificity. Creators are at the center of consumer trust today.
Narrativ’s technology gives all brands and creators - not just the top 1% - the tools to win in the $50 billion creator economy by building trust with consumers, not selling ads. We’ve been recognized as a World Economic Forum Technology Pioneer and one of Fast Company World’s Most Innovative Companies alongside... giants like Google, Microsoft, and Slack.
Do you share our vision for decentralizing the institutions that control the Internet today? Come join our team.
Why you should work here:
We’re growing fast, without constantly diluting your equity: Narrativ is growing 3-4X year over year (yep, you read that right). Hundreds of brands joined Narrativ’s platform in the last year, from enterprises like Best Buy, Sephora, and Samsung, to rising brands like Yeti, Cariuma, and Peace Out Skincare.
Massive TAM, unique approach: We’re tackling the creator economy and e-commerce, a $50-150 billion market. Narrativ’s unique approach is that we believe technology is not neutral – its values are encoded by its creators. We value integrity, specificity, and diversity (not just scale at all costs).
Join a strong, diverse team: We’re more than doubling in size and growing to a team of 130 by the end of the year. Narrativ is committed to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion – more than 50% of our leadership team are women. We’ve taken the 15% pledge both in our talent strategy and across creators on our platform. We’re amplifying our diverse team’s support of communities of color by matching 200% of all individual donations as a company.
Last, but very important, we are a startup: We’re looking for people who aren’t afraid to wield the chaos that comes with true creation, explore ambiguity, set the bar for excellence, and have full ownership over their impact. You’ll never be a cog in a machine here, but you won’t have the established blueprints of being one either. If all this sounds exciting to you, come join us.

Overall
Narrativ is looking for a Senior UX Designer to help usher our products into their next phase. This role reports to the head of product.
Your outcomes in the first 1-2 years
You have helped craft the vision of what our client-facing products you will be transforming the complex into simple; raw data into usable insights.
You have helped us reimagine how our users do their work: from marketers at the hottest brands and retailers; to writers, editors, and creators who write the internet’s most trusted recommendations.
You have externalized our internal tools into the self-serve platform necessary to scale and grow the company.
About You
Track record of success: Has built an end-to-end experience that people currently use.
Structured thinking and communication: Able to walk people through complex design decisions, both verbally and in writing.
Backbone / building trust: Has a point of view, is willing to share it, has ability to persuade, is willing to disagree and commit.
Adaptability: Has worked in a fast-paced environment — bringing well-worn frameworks to the table and the confidence to break from them when necessary.
Baseline: 5+ years doing UX design. Comfort leading user interviews. Experience with at least one of these three things: (1) data/dashboards or other dense, complex UX; (2) digital publishing workflows in news or magazines; (3) ecommerce marketing.

Important Notice: Narrativ will be going fully remote in 2021 and anticipate being a fully remote organization moving forward!
Narrativ is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or veteran status

title: Senior UX Designer
description:

Rockstar Games is seeking a talented Senior User Experience (UX) Designer to join the Marketing Department at our Manhattan, NYC studios.

The ideal candidate is a multi-disciplinary UX designer that has very strong interactive and usability design skills. They possess a deep understanding of the advantages and limitations of digital media to create work that is aesthetically stunning, legible, and usable. This person will collaborate with other designers, developers, project managers, and producers across departments, and work in an extremely fast paced work environment that demands a strong work... ethic, attention to detail, and ability to turnaround tight deadlines.

What We Do
• Our digital UI/UX designers work within the Art and Marketing teams, focusing on web, app, and digital marketing designs that reflect the high visual and experience standards set throughout the company.
• We work very closely with teams across all of publishing, as well as our development studios worldwide.
• Our digital experiences are often the first thing people see on any Rockstar product and we take great pride in creating and ensuring exceptional user experience for this unique and iconic brand.
• We support our employees with a culture of career development, safety, and inclusion.

Responsibilities
• Approach design from a user’s perspective, listening to users and balancing their needs alongside business goals and technical capabilities.
• Conduct research and analysis to define audience needs
• Formulate concepts and requirements into high level UX artifacts such as site architecture maps, user journey maps, process flows, user personas, and low fidelity interactive prototype.
• Balance marketing goals with research insights in order to generate unique digital solutions
• Collaborate with fellow interface designers and developers to help evolve the design language of our digital presence.
• Communicate data-informed vision and design rationales to cross-functional stakeholders.
• Document design flows and design decisions in a consistent, accurate manner
• Communicate design flows and concepts with interface designers, graphic designers, creative, and marketing directors.

Qualifications
• 5+ years experience designing and shipping successful consumer-facing products in a fast-paced technology environment.
• An online portfolio featuring amazing user-centric design approaches.
• Mentorship experience highly desired.
• Strong understanding of the strengths and shortcomings of different UX approaches including when and how to apply them during the product development process.
• Knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, Figma, and other interaction design software
• Experience working closely with a cross-functional team of designers, software engineers, product managers, and key stakeholders through all product development phases.
• Experience articulating conceptual design decisions to non-designers.
• A demonstrated track record of managing time effectively with a high degree of self-sufficiency.
• A passion for Rockstar Games and our titles.

Skills
• Creative, collaborative, and adaptable.
• Ability to utilize rapid prototyping and iterative design techniques.
• Ability to deliver engineering-friendly design specifications and documentation.
• Excellent communication, organization, and interpersonal skills.
• Ability to present to senior stakeholders and facilitate broader design discussions within the team
• Comfortable operating in a fast-moving, fluid, startup environment.
• Capable of prioritization across numerous high impact tasks and projects.
• Ability to perform at a high level whether working as part of a team or independently.
• A strong work ethic and a desire to get the job done right no matter what.

PLUSES

Please note that these are desirable skills and are not required to apply for the position.
• A love of video games, film, and entertainment.
• Smart, conceptual, confident, competent, adaptable, proactive, and results-oriented.
• Earnest, mature, and ego-free. You welcome candid feedback and can constructively give it as well.
• You embrace change and ambiguity as an opportunity for design to lead product development with new features and user goals.

How To Apply

Please apply with a resume and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the skills above. If we would like to move forward with your application, a Rockstar recruiter will reach out to you to explain next steps and guide you through the process.

Rockstar is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to hiring, promoting, and compensating employees based on their qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities.

If you’ve got the right skills for the job, we want to hear from you. We encourage applications from all suitable candidates regardless of age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, belief, or race

• Experience in advertising or marketing is a plus
• Data-driven and obsessed with measurable impact of a campaign
• Strong portfolio demonstrating UX thinking and process, visual design skills, and crafting interactive/digital experiences that solve for a customer/business problem

MORE ABOUT THIS JOB

About the Job

As we build the next generation of digital products, success will be defined by the quality of the User Experience. The job of UX Designer is to research, design, and help deliver digital products that delight our users while satisfying the firm’s business goals.

As a member of the UX team, you will be responsible for defining the form and function of web, desktop, & mobile applications. You will work with business and development teams in a variety of businesses at Goldman Sachs to define, design, and validate the user experience for internal and external users. In addition, you will help shape our overall design system and visual language, with a code library that is used in hundreds of projects at the firm.

About the Project

The first and primary project you’ll be assigned to is our customer relationship management (CRM) platform for the Global Markets division. The Global Markets Client Relationship Management (CRM) team is composed of... driven, talented and passionate individuals who work closely with the business to manage client engagement and deliver intelligent workflows with exciting, impactful analytics to serve our clients as One Goldman Sachs. The CRM team is comprised of Product Managers, Software Engineers and User Experience designers.

Why Join Us

Our User Experience team is diverse and global. You will be joining a nimble, cross-disciplinary team of designers, developers, and researchers in offices in the US, Europe, and Asia. We enjoy taking deep dives into complex problems, surrounded by a network of passionate people who help each other grow. Our team's range of skills and diversity of approaches allows us to partner with business and technology teams firm-wide to create applications that are easy to use, engaging, powerful, and competitive. Our team is unique in that it is directly responsible for the software that many products are built with. Our Engineers are as passionate about micro interactions as the designers are.

title: UX Designer
description:
Paige is a software company helping pathologists and clinicians make faster, more informed diagnostic and treatment decisions by mining decades of data from the world’s experts in cancer care. We are leading a digital transformation in pathology by leveraging advanced Artificial Intelligence (AI) technology to create value for the oncology clinical team.

We are the first company to develop clinical grade AI tools for the pathologist, which resulted in our receiving FDA breakthrough designation for our first product. Paige has also received FDA-clearance for our digital viewer, FullFocus™. We have also established multiple relationships with biopharma, laboratory, and equipment manufacturers that enables Paige to develop an ecosystem ready to help patients receive better diagnoses and treatment.

We’re seeking a passionate UX Designer to join our growing UX Team. In this role, you’ll design, refine and implement new product experiences. This is an extraordinary opportunity to be part... of a high-performing team and to pursue a life-changing mission.

This role is fully remote right now. When it's safe to return, we'd love to have you work a few days a week from our HQ at 11 Times Square in midtown NYC. The main reason for this is because you'll go on-location to different sites we have in NYC and work with clinicians. Additionally, you'll also collaborate in studies at our office.

You’ll enjoy this role if you:
• Are thoughtful and proactive problem solver
• Create simple, unique and robust solutions to complex problems
• Can drive initiatives across the finish line, working with various stakeholders

Key Responsibilities:
• Develop consumer-grade visual designs and ensure consistency across products.
• Work closely with stakeholders (e.g. pathologists), product management, science, and engineering to design information architectures and workflows that support product strategy.
• Create and deliver UX deliverables, including wireframes, mock-ups, and prototypes.
• Work closely with front-end team to oversee the execution and implementation of product designs.
• Design a dynamic, user-friendly and consumer grade user experience.
• Actively support user testing and analysis of results.
• Participate in the creation of style guides and champion UX standards.
• Operate within a highly regulated environment (eg. to align with FDA requirements).

Requirements:
• You have a 2+ years of experience as a UX Designer in commercial settings, designing scalable and consumer-grade products.
• You hold a minimum of a Bachelors degree in graphic design or a related field, or equivalent years of experience.
• Experience building upon design systems and ensuring usability best practices.
• Solid foundations in visual design principles (typography, layout, color, etc.).
• You thrive on collecting and leveraging user data to drive UX design solutions.
• Highly detail-oriented with strong communication skills.
• Strong working knowledge of Figma or Sketch, and Adobe Creative Suite required.
• Knowledge of executing UX principles within Agile/Lean software development environment
• Preferred: Experience working in a start-up environment and with healthcare products
